articles.author: Jason Lange, Bo Erickson
articles.description: Democrat Kamala Harris leads Republican Donald Trump 45% to 41% in a Reuters/Ipsos poll published on Thursday that showed the vice president sparking new enthusiasm among voters and shaking up the race ahead of the Nov. 5 election.
articles.title: Exclusive: Harris widens lead over Trump with boost from women, Hispanics, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem
articles.description: Palestinians in Gaza were waiting on Thursday to see if there would be a pause in fighting to allow a polio vaccination campaign to begin, as the conflict raged across the besieged enclave, killing at least 20 people.
articles.title: Fighting rages in Gaza as Palestinians hope for a pause for polio vaccinations

articles.author: Satoshi Sugiyama, Kiyoshi Takenaka
articles.description: At least three people were killed in southwestern Japan on Thursday as Typhoon Shanshan made landfall in Kagoshima prefecture, bringing heavy rain and very strong winds as well as snarling air traffic and knocking out power to over a quarter million households.
articles.title: Typhoon Shanshan makes landfall in Japan, killing 3 and snarling air traffic

articles.author: Michael Martina
articles.description: The U.S. Defense Department, NASA and other government agencies funded research that led to more than 1,000 U.S. patents for China-based inventors since 2010, including in sensitive fields such as biotechnology and semiconductors, data from the U.S. patent agency showed.
articles.title: Exclusive: US government funding yielded hundreds of patents for China-based researchers

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A lawyer for Telegram boss Pavel Durov, who is being investigated in France, said it was "totally absurd" to suggest the head of a social network was responsible for any criminal acts committed on the platform, French media said.
articles.title: Telegram boss's lawyer dismisses probe against Durov as absurd

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's top commander Oleksandr Syrskyi said on Thursday he spent several days on the eastern Pokrovsk front and described fighting there as "exceptionally tough".
articles.title: Ukraine's top commander says fighting on Pokrovsk front 'exceptionally tough'

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan met Chinese President Xi Jinping in Beijing on Thursday, wrapping up three days of wide-ranging talks aimed at easing tensions between the two world powers ahead of November's U.S. election.
articles.title: Sullivan meets Xi as wide-ranging China-US talks near end in Beijing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The captain of Mike Lynch's yacht flew out of Palermo on Thursday, 10 days after the British tech tycoon and six other people were killed when the vessel sank off the coast of Sicily.
articles.title: Captain of Mike Lynch's yacht leaves Sicily on private jet

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Hong Kong court on Thursday found two editors of the now-defunct Stand News media outlet guilty of conspiring to publish seditious publications in a case that has drawn international scrutiny amid a security crackdown in the China-ruled city.
articles.title: Hong Kong court finds two ex-Stand News editors guilty of sedition

articles.author: Crispian Balmer
articles.description: Oscar-winning documentary maker Errol Morris premiered his latest work at the Venice Film Festival on Thursday, picking apart one of former President Donald Trump's most contested policies - family separations at the U.S.-Mexico border.
articles.title: Migrant separation documentary hits Venice, shines light on Trump policy
